result_indicator_period_actual_comment_n: In addition to the IMAS and TNMAs being developed or update, 4 Technical and Evaluation Protocols were also developed during Q2

During the reporting period, the GICHD worked on developing outreach material on All reasonable effort (ARE), one of the key thematics planned for IMAS outreach in 2022. An outreach workshop is foreseeable in Q3/Q4 in Iraq, possibly in Libya and West Africa. 
The GICHD will also host a side event during the NDM-UN meeting in June 2022. In Q1, preparations for the event celebrating ’20 years of IMAS’ was ongoing. Internally, a concept note was developed and reviewed along with other discussions on the communication strategy.

During the reporting period, the GICHD delivered a global workshop on All reasonable effort (ARE) funded by another donor but where some dutch funds were used. ARE is one of the key thematics planned for IMAS outreach in 2022. An initial workshop was delivered in Senegal to 5 national mine action authorities in Senegal, Mauritania, Chad, Burkina-Faso, Guinea-Bissau . An outreach workshop is foreseeable in Q3/Q4 in West Africa. 
The GICHD also hosted a side event during the NDM-UN meeting in June 2022: the mine action community was informed about the revised and new IMAS documents recently released.

In this reporting period, the GICHD prepared for the scoping workshop in West Africa as reported in the last quarter. The GICHD will be conducting a scoping assessment and workshop in Mauritania and Guinea-Bissau in October 2022 to collect evidence of the current situation: i) assessment of the type of contamination (initial or residual) and its impact; ii) actual capacities (at the level of the National Mine Action Authorities and at the level of operators). This will also be an opportunity to identify the needs and possible interventions from the GICHD for the management of residual contamination. 
In parallel and through the Francophone Regional Cooperation Programme, the GICHD has initiated regional support in francophone West Africa through a workshop previously. A second workshop will happen during Q4 2022.

During Q4 2022, workshops have been conducted in Mauritania, Senegal and Benin with a focus on land release including all reasonable effort. During another regional workshop in Benin, the new requirements of the IMAS 06.10 on the management of training and the EOD and IEDD standard competencies have been presented and explained.

During the reporting period, the GICHD coordinated 6 Technical Working Groups responsible for the review of IMAS 04.10, IMAS 05.10, IMAS 06.10, IMAS 08.40, TNMA 10.10/01 and TNMA 12.10/01. 
The GICHD will continue to coordinate these Technical Working Groups during Q2, Q3 and Q4.

During the reporting period, the GICHD coordinated 6 Technical Working Groups responsible for the review of IMAS 04.10, IMAS 05.10, IMAS 06.10, IMAS 08.40, TNMA 10.10/01 and TNMA 12.10/01 and for the development of ADS competencies.
The GICHD will continue to coordinate these Technical Working Groups during  Q3 and Q4. The Tests and Evaluation Protocols for EOD competencies and for IEDD competencies as well as the IMAS 09.30 on EOD and the Test and Evaluation Protocols on Animal Detection Systems testing and testing sites have been revised and approved by the IMAS Review Board.

In this reporting period, the development of IMAS 07.50 on the management of human remains has been completed as well as Test and Evaluation protocol 07.31/02/2002 on competencies for Animal Detection Systems . The normative requirements for the management of terms and definitions has been included in the IMAS 04.10. The IMAS 06.10 on the management of training, the IMAS 08.40 on marking, the Technical note for mine action on Improvised Explosive Device Risk Education have been revised. All these documents have been adopted by the UN Inter Agency Coordination Group for Mine Action and included in the IMAS framework.
During Q4, the GICHD will organise a global IMAS outreach training. Preparations will begin in Q2.
During Q4, the GICHD will organise a global IMAS outreach training. Preparations have begun in Q2.

During Q4, the GICHD will organise a NMAS development course (previously IMAS and conformance). The preparations including selection of participants and logistical arrangements were completed in Q3. The course will pan over 5 days and participants from more than 10 countries are expected. The course sponsorship of participants will be cost shared.
